title: Bi-Weekly Gaming Discussion Thread
selftext:
What are you playing, r/India? Let us use this thread to discuss any games you're playing, have played or are going to play. (Mobile and board games included!)

What game are you looking forward to? Are you a developer? Show us your wares!

Please don't just list the names of games, make sure to write a word or two about them as well.

Check out r/IndianGaming! They are an active community and also host a few co-op sessions.

**Gaming Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Gaming+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/xagdqefyv8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=d7cc8834fbf21d8da84189cc06a5b7e1b5677686
comments: Playing monster hunter world. Absolutely addicted. Bought the iceborne dlc too today. Other than that doing my weekly dnd campaign. Not sure if that falls under gaming though.

Hey there, 

anyone using hubspot here??

check out our new tool for hubspot and whatsapp integration on www.assistro.co
Have a group of college mates since 11 years to play dota, CS and AOE. Helps me not fall into depression
Anyone here hooked to Valheim yet?

Kingdoms of Amalur Reckoning

So far its fun. Not great not terrible. Anyone wants to play and is doubtful feel free to ask me questions.
I really liked this game when it first released. I went full mage route and used to decimate my enemies with one lightening move.
Yeah I played it recently too; it's a fun enough game .
Jedi: Fallen Order is such a fun game. I guess the second part is coming out soon.
Resident Evil 4 reboot. Such great fun. Highly Recommend. üëçüëç
recommendations for nice strategy game please ?
